page.title: 15BLACKBUSHE AIRPORT
page.content: Blackbushe Airport was constructed on the common during the war for light bombers.The airfield was used to land the wounded,too.The runways were on both sides of the A30 and traffic had to stop to allow planes to take off.After the war it became the country's second largest airport as a large number of holiday flights used it. It continued in civil use until 1960.A museum of historic aircraft was started here.It is soon to be the site for truck and car auctions, at the same time maintaining a runway for light aircraft and flying school. Caravans are also sold here and drag races and a Sunday market are held on this site.
